name: places/ChIJwWU7GH8IZkARf3rQothk9gk
formattedAddress: 256 W 116th St, New York, NY 10026, USA
adrFormatAddress: 256 W 116th St, New York, NY 10026-2406, USA

originalText.text: Currently living in an apartment owned my Trihill and managed by New Holland. If it was possible to give 0 stars I would. This is legitimately the worst rental company I have ever come in contact with. They reel you in with what seems to be a nice and unique property and fluffed information about amenities and then screw you over repeatedly. We have had a very dangerous amount of BLACK MOLD growing on one side of the apartment since November and it took them TWO MONTHS to get maintenance in here to “fix” it, and by fix I mean they sprayed it with bleach and told us we’d be fine (it came back shortly after and I’ve had to spend unnecessary amounts of time spraying and scrubbing it off of our walls) Not only did it take maintenance 2 months to come in, they let themselves in with little to no warning on multiple occasions. We have attempted to contact the company on countless occasions about getting things fixed, getting the rent reduced, getting heat and we get 0 response. They don’t answer their phones and the best response we get is a link to maintenance request forms, which mind you they almost never follow trough with. We’ve had 3 separate shelves snap with plates and glassware on them nearly crush us, barely any heat (its literally 50-60 degrees or less in our apartment in the middle of winter), black mold, leaks from the windows, maintenance people letting themselves in with no notice, packages stolen and very very little correspondence. High. Class. Slum. Lords. They don’t care about their tenants or the buildings all they want is their money. Avoid them at All Costs. Yeah, the apartment is cool but its just not worth the constant fight trying to make the place safe and livable.

originalText.text:
If you are a prospective tenant, DO NOT RENT as this company is completely untrustworthy. They will ignore your calls no matter how severe your issue. They simply don't care. All they want is your money.

Here is the pattern I've experienced with them: I discover something faulty in the unit and report the issue, two weeks later they set up a time to inspect the unit, one week later someone may or may not come by to inspect, two more weeks pass and nothing happens. I call them again. Two weeks later they set up an appointment to inspect. Nothing happens and the cycle continues. This has gone on for MONTHS now. It is a sick, cyclical game they play so they can take your money while fixing NOTHING in return. These people are morally bankrupt.

*** If you are a current tenant. Please call 311 and file a complaint with the NYC Department of Buildings. No one deserves to have their money taken by a company that will not repair anything and jeopardize your health for the sole purpose of profit.

CALL 311 and REPORT.

originalText.text: The worst leasing company/landlords I have ever had to deal with.  Throughout my year experience with them not only did they mislead me on amenities included with my apartment, they consistently withheld services that are required of a leasing company.  Their response times are awful, they seem to not care at all about their tenants, and essentially forced me out of my apartment during the pandemic.  Would give 0 stars if i could.  PLEASE consider living elsewhere; their apartments, their service and their management are absolutely abhorrent. Save yourself a headache and don't pay for their over-priced units.

originalText.text: Since this company has bought our building we have had an insane amount of problems.  They fired our wonderful super and didnt have a replacement for 2 months.  Getting in touch with someone when something does break is a nightmare. Literally impossible.  And now they are claiming they have no lease on file and are trying to extort us for money.  Our old landlords said they have received multiple calls from old tenants about the same thing - New Holland are scam artists

originalText.text:
This company is almost impossible to get a hold of. I have tried many, many times to get in contact with them about putting bars on my first floor apartment windows and have not received ANY kind of response. Sometimes, when I call the call is just dropped for no reason. I have left messages, emailed, called, reached out through my realtor, and still no response. I wish I had chosen a different apartment with a more professional management company. Avoid these people at all costs, all they want is your money.

Update: since leaving my review, NHR has copied and pasted their apologies in response to my review, proving my one star review to be not only accurate, but generous.
